author: Adam Williams
comment: 2 stars because of the horrible experience using the Rouge Player. Haven't used the app for anything else. When watching a movie Rouge player randomly plays the same 3 minutes of commercials every 10 minutes which is fine since you can skip them. But then the movie resets every single time. I pad goes to sleep? Movie resets. Lock your I pad?  Movie resets. Plane announcement? Movie resets.

author: Karl Kirschenman
comment: Consistently crashes trying to open boarding passes from menu panel. Other "view boarding pass" buttons in the app simply do not work.

author: Claude Khan
comment: This app lets me track multiple trips, flights, and boarding passes. Updating flights in real time. I love it.
Finally supports multiple boarding passes and live updates! Thanks AC!

author: Robert Long
comment: Air Canada actually replied to my original posting and told me that the app could do this if you linked the accounts. This was not obvious to me so there is a problem there but it did work after I looked into it. The app does retrieve my information now. Way better.   Thanks for responding.  When a person signs in it should pull up their flights not ask you to submit tracking numbers - useless app - perhaps the writers should try using it.

reply.author: Air Canada
reply.content: All your bookings can be automatically imported by linkings your Aeroplan account with your Air Canada mobile+ account. Learn more by reading the app description, or try it out from Menu / Settings / Link Aeroplan Account. Once you've linked, you won't need to enter your booking reference, and your bookings will be automatically sync'd in the app.

author: Chris Newell
comment: AC, please stop replying telling everyone that the log in is different.  There is a problem with you app right now.  My existing password doesn't work any longer, and neither does trying to reset it.  Please let us know when we can expect to log in again.

reply.author: Air Canada
reply.content: We're sorry to hear you're having issues with the app. While the account on mobile is different than that of Aeroplan or aircanada.com, we were unable to reproduce any outage with AC mobile+. Try logging in at http://flyac.ca/acmplus - if you're able to log in there, then try the same email/password in the app. Need help? Email mobile@aircanada.ca

author: Patrick Deschamps
comment: Honestly, I do not understand the huge ranting going on about this app. It is working very well, tracking my future flights, having my Aeroplan synced, etc. The features are working as expected and information is provided as expected. I am just removing 1 star for excessive unnecessary visual information... It can be simpler and even more intuitive for its purpose.

author: Lynn Daniel
comment: AC can you tell me why I can't log into my account via the app? Works fine without the app. When I try to log into the app it says my email and password isn't valid. What's the point of having an app for convenience when you can't even log in. This is infuriating. EDIT: Thanks AC, that fixed my problem. Works fine now. 😀

reply.author: Air Canada
reply.content: The app uses Air Canada mobile+ for it's login and profile, which is different than the login that you use on the Air Canada website, and provides a lot of additional features and functionality, such as syncing with Aeroplan, saving your booked flights, storing your credit cards securely, and more! Sign up in the app today from Menu / Settings.

author: John Jerry
comment: Unlike the Mac version this doesn't have an offline schedule. Also, once checked in it offers SMS or email. It remembers your last used number... sort of. It's there. Except for the country code.. and there's no way to enter the country code! So you have to reenter it! Come on!  just gets worse.. AC Life if you link it to your ets it will lock you out of all your travel sites in AC.. all of them! good luck getting it back

reply.author: Air Canada
reply.content: Thank you for your feedback. Just like the iOS app, you can download the offline schedule from the app's 'Settings', and then 'Preferences'. We have noted the SMS country code issue previously and it has already been fixed in our development build. Update coming soon! If you experiencing any other issues, please write us at android@aircanada.ca

author: Peter Germann
comment: Cant sign in app at all. 0/100 Logged into website, my bookings dont exist! 0/100. Not impressed and slightly worried...

reply.author: Air Canada
reply.content: The app uses Air Canada mobile+ for it's login and profile, which is different than the login that you use on the Air Canada website, and provides a lot of additional features and functionality, such as syncing with Aeroplan, saving your booked flights, storing your credit cards securely, and more! Sign up in the app today from Menu / Settings.

author: Kevin Everets
comment: Onboard video on Rouge didn't work. Was the only reason I downloaded this massively bloated app.

author: Marc Crandall
comment: Can't log in to app with valid credentials.

reply.author: Air Canada
reply.content: The app uses Air Canada mobile+ for it's login and profile, which is different than the login that you use on the Air Canada website, and provides a lot of additional features and functionality, such as syncing with Aeroplan, saving your booked flights, storing your credit cards securely, and more! Sign up in the app today from Menu / Settings.

comment: Absolute joke of an airline. Avoid at all cost.

author: Adam Romain
comment: Can I access the app on my laptop?  Playstore doesn't permit download...

author: Paul Johnson-Ross
comment: Will not work

author: e mezhik
comment: Can't login via app  [Edited 20-Feb-2018]. Got response from the app developer saying "The app uses Air Canada mobile+ for it's login and profile, which is different than the login that you use on the Air Canada website". This is the problem in the first place. Why there needs to be another login for AirCanada? How many logins/passwords one needs to maintain for AirCanada? Furthermore, the login page of the app didn't say that the account for this app is different from AirCanada website. And, honestly, I'd be suspicious if it would have.

reply.author: Air Canada
reply.content: Thank you for your feedback. "Air Canada mobile+" is indicated at the top of the log in screen and is different than your Aeroplan login. In turn, AC mobile+ provides a lot of functionality unavailable to other profiles, such as stored travellers and payments, and cross-device sync/backup of your booked flights. Questions? Email mobile@aircanada.ca

author: Wayne Niittynen
comment: Air canada  you blew it with the last update....I have a number of bookings which I saved on the app. ... Now have to search for my emails to find confirmation numbers...W.T.F.... A giant step backwards. ...

author: Tabatha Parent
comment: Every time I try to check in with this app it does not work and I have to go to see a agent.

author: Tony Ratkov
comment: Would appreciate being able to provide feedback on particular flights through the application.

reply.author: Air Canada
reply.content: We've recently added this feature in our latest update. Look for the home screen tile when your next flight lands, and tell us what you think about your flight. We look forward to your feedback!

author: Daniel Wong
comment: Can't login with email on Altitude profile.

reply.author: Air Canada
reply.content: The app uses Air Canada mobile+ for it's login and profile, which is different than the login that you use on the Air Canada website, and provides a lot of additional features and functionality, such as syncing with Aeroplan, saving your booked flights, storing your credit cards securely, and more! Sign up in the app today from Menu / Settings.

author: émilie Laliberté
comment: Can't link me Aeroplan account, super slow...
Sucks

author: Hugh Leung
comment: This app makes no sense. The web page uses your Aeroplan number as your login. But this app needs your email. But my email is listed in my air Canada account, but I can't log in using the mobile app because it thinks the email address is invalid.

reply.author: Air Canada
reply.content: The app uses Air Canada mobile+ for it's login and profile, which is different than the login that you use on the Air Canada website, and provides a lot of additional features and functionality, such as syncing with Aeroplan, saving your booked flights, storing your credit cards securely, and more! Sign up in the app today from Menu / Settings.

author: David Kaye
comment: This is an effective means of Air Canada not having to pay for screens on every seat.  It only works as well as the terrible Wi-Fi on the flight.  The rest of the app is pointless.

author: Raz Diacu
comment: Terrible app. Don't open your travel partner's pass in the app or it will hold on to it and refuse to show yours, even after you delete theirs and open yours. Had to delete the app to try to get rid of it.

Completely and utterly pointless app. Serves no purpose other than to store your booked flights on it. Has no edit, reroute or seat change function and you don't appear to be able to check in on it either.

author: Yummo Can
comment: Super super super glitchy. Basically spent half my flight trying to get a movie loaded and when I finally did when I tried to remind 30s it crashed and spent another 30 minutes getting started again. BUT it does NOT remember where you left off limenthe traditional back of seats screen. When I checked in it doesn't add the trip to my trips. You have to do it separately horrible

author: Roger L Pelland
comment: Keeps crashing or telling me no info is available, or matching their systems. Also keeps telling me im not connected to any data/wifi service, when i am. This app sucks

author: Brannon In HD
comment: I was unable to login and it said my email was wrong even though I was entering it correctly. I am 100% I inserted nothing wrong

author: Graham Smith
comment: Can't pay for luggage during check in, get error("payment incomplete") and then I can't complete the check in . If a mistake is made, can't go back.  Added a credit card to app, but I can't select it for payment, so what's the point?

author: Thomas Isidean
comment: Terrible app for terrible airline. Regularly freezes up. They now charge for family members to sit together. Delete the app and avoid the airline.

author: Barb Graham
comment: Hate this app.  Westjet has it beat be far.  My flight was canceled and rebooked an hour ago and I'm still getting notifications about the old flights.

author: Joohyung Kim
comment: It's very buggy. Constantly crash/shows it's offline when it's clearly connected. Not usable

author: Fan Huang
comment: This is a good app. Has some intelligent input features like auto-capping names and addresses. It's easy to book flights, to manage the bookings, and to check-in. It is easy to retrieve bookings and to view the boarding pass. This is one of the best flight apps I've seen.

author: Steve Sturrock
comment: A billion dollar company can't make a basic functional app. The story of Air Canada I think.

author: Mike Bedard
comment: Terrible app, does not work for in Rouge in-flight entertainment totally useless, frustrating and a waste of time.

author: Andrew Humphries
comment: Media player is garbage. None of the controls work, cant pause, or seek. If the movie is interrupted, have to begin from the start.
Battery killer. Has a weird glitch where if I open from notification, the screen goes to max brightness and I can't change it, no matter what my settings are.

author: Andrew Wesson
comment: Air Canada Rouge in-flight entertainment did not load at all on Asus C302CA (which is fine because Android app support isnt perfect yet) or HTC one m9 (which is not fine).  Wouldn't have even had to use this app if their web player used modern standards but it uses flash.

author: Gilles Galipeau Jr
comment: Terrible. Player did not work at all
